alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:21PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Monroe and Noble. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 221 PM EST, the public reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 0.7 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.7 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dudley, Dexter City, Stafford and Harriettsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
